actor_awards.notes: Won the National Board of Review Award for Best Actor for 'Fourteen Hours' (1951). Nominated for a BAFTA for Best Foreign Actor for 'Time Limit' (1957). He is also widely known for his television role as Admiral Harriman Nelson in 'Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea'.

filmography.title: La Strada
filmography.role_description: A carefree, philosophical high-wire walker who teases the brutish strongman Zampanò and befriends the waif Gelsomina.
filmography.plot: A carefree girl is sold to a traveling entertainer, enduring physical and emotional pain along the way.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Foreign Language Film (Film)

filmography.title: Moby Dick
filmography.role_description: The narrator and sole survivor of the Pequod's doomed voyage to hunt the white whale.
filmography.plot: The sole survivor of a lost whaling ship relates the tale of his captain's self-destructive obsession to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Director

filmography.title: He Walked by Night
filmography.role_description: A brilliant, elusive, and psychopathic burglar who kills a police officer and engages in a cat-and-mouse game with the authorities.
filmography.plot: A resourceful criminal evades the police after killing an officer, using his knowledge of police procedure to stay one step ahead.

filmography.title: Fourteen Hours
filmography.role_description: A distraught young man who stands on the ledge of a high-rise building, threatening to jump while police and family try to talk him down.
filmography.plot: A police officer tries to talk a young man down from the ledge of a tall building.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Il Bidone
filmography.role_description: A small-time con artist and painter who struggles with his conscience while swindling poor peasants.
filmography.plot: Three swindlers tour the Italian countryside, disguising themselves to fleece peasants of their savings.

filmography.title: Time Limit
filmography.role_description: A highly decorated officer accused of collaborating with the enemy in a Korean POW camp.
filmography.plot: An investigator tries to uncover why a highly decorated officer collaborated with the enemy in a Korean POW camp.

filmography.title: Being There
filmography.role_description: The personal physician to a wealthy industrialist who becomes intrigued by the simple gardener Chance.
filmography.plot: A simple-minded gardener named Chance becomes an unlikely advisor to a powerful businessman and an insider in Washington politics.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Melvyn Douglas)

filmography.title: The Brothers Karamazov
filmography.role_description: The intellectual and skeptical middle brother in the adaptation of Dostoevsky's novel.
filmography.plot: The four sons of a lecherous father react to his murder in 19th-century Russia.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: Titanic
filmography.role_description: A defrocked priest traveling on the ill-fated ship who finds redemption in his final hours.
filmography.plot: An unhappily married couple struggle to deal with their problems while on board the ill-fated ship.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Writing, Story and Screenplay

filmography.title: Decision Before Dawn
filmography.role_description: An American intelligence officer tasked with managing German prisoners recruited to spy for the Allies.
filmography.plot: In the final days of WWII, the US Army recruits German prisoners to spy behind Nazi lines.

filmography.title: Tension
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered pharmacist who creates an alter ego to murder his wife's lover but becomes the prime suspect when the lover is killed.
filmography.plot: A pharmacist plots to kill his wife's lover but decides against it, only to become a suspect when the man is murdered anyway.

filmography.title: Reign of Terror
filmography.role_description: The fanatical and ruthless leader of the French Revolution's Reign of Terror.
filmography.plot: During the French Revolution, a group of moderates tries to overthrow the tyranny of Robespierre.

filmography.title: Fixed Bayonets!
filmography.role_description: A corporal in the Korean War who fears the burden of command but must take charge when his superiors are killed.
filmography.plot: During the Korean War, a corporal who is afraid of responsibility is forced to take command of his platoon.

filmography.title: The House on Telegraph Hill
filmography.role_description: A charming but possibly dangerous man who marries a Holocaust survivor claiming a false identity.
filmography.plot: A concentration camp survivor assumes the identity of a deceased friend to inherit her fortune but finds danger in San Francisco.

filmography.title: Repeat Performance
filmography.role_description: A poet and friend of the protagonist who plays a key role in the time-loop narrative.
filmography.plot: A woman shoots her husband on New Year's Eve, then wishes she could live the year over again—and gets her wish.

filmography.title: Cry Wolf
filmography.role_description: The younger husband of a wealthy widow who gets involved in a mystery at her late husband's estate.
filmography.plot: A widow visits her late husband's family estate to claim her inheritance but suspects foul play regarding his death.

filmography.title: The Satan Bug
filmography.role_description: A scientist involved in the theft of a deadly biological weapon capable of destroying life on Earth.
filmography.plot: A former intelligence agent is brought back to investigate the theft of a deadly biological weapon.

filmography.title: Kings of the Sun
filmography.role_description: The high priest of the Mayan people who clashes with the young king over traditions and sacrifice.
filmography.plot: A Mayan king flees his homeland and tries to settle in North America, clashing with a Native American tribe.

filmography.title: Chato's Land
filmography.role_description: A member of a posse hunting a half-Apache man who becomes the hunted.
filmography.plot: A half-Apache man kills a sheriff in self-defense and is hunted by a posse through the desert.

filmography.title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
filmography.role_description: The leader of the Humanimals who enforces the laws set by Dr. Moreau.
filmography.plot: A shipwrecked survivor discovers a scientist conducting horrific genetic experiments on an island.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nomination – Best Science Fiction Film

filmography.title: Hitler
filmography.role_description: Basehart plays the title role in this biopic depicting the private life and rise of the German dictator.
filmography.plot: A biography of the German dictator, focusing on his private life and psychological state.

filmography.title: Outside the Wall
filmography.role_description: An ex-convict who struggles to adjust to life outside prison and resists being pulled back into crime.
filmography.plot: An ex-convict struggles to adjust to life outside prison and gets mixed up with a gang planning a heist.

filmography.title: Roseanna McCoy
filmography.role_description: A member of the Hatfield clan in this drama about the famous family feud.
filmography.plot: The story of the legendary feud between the Hatfields and McCoys, focusing on the romance between Roseanna and Johnse.

filmography.title: Five Branded Women
filmography.role_description: A German soldier involved with five Yugoslavian women who are shorn and cast out for associating with him.
filmography.plot: Five Yugoslavian women accused of consorting with Nazis are shorn and cast out, eventually joining the partisans.

filmography.title: The Savage Guns
filmography.role_description: An embittered gunfighter who tries to retire in a Mexican valley but is drawn into a conflict.
filmography.plot: An embittered gunfighter tries to retire in a Mexican valley but is drawn into a conflict between ranchers and a land baron.

filmography.title: Rage
filmography.role_description: A doctor who treats a rancher and his son after they are exposed to a chemical weapon.
filmography.plot: A rancher seeks revenge after his son is killed by an experimental chemical weapon test.
